      Training Commences

      less than 1 minute read

      Training actually commenced 3 weeks ago, a few days after official notification that I was in for the first annual Iowa Wind and Rock. There’s no magic formula on training for a 340 mile gravel race. My goal was just to get started with some base training since my riding and racing severely declined since mid-summer, leaving me in a pretty deep fitness hole. I turned to Trainer Road , which I used last winter, for a plan to get me going in short fashion.

      Trainer Road breaks up training into Base, Build and Specialty Phases:

      Within each phase you choose an appropriate target and volume. Here’s my initial approach:

      Phase Target Volume Length
      Base Sweet Spot Base Mid Volume I & II 12 weeks
      Build Sustained Power Mid Volume 8 weeks
      Specialty Century Mid Volume 8 weeks

      There’s a couple of items to note here. First, you can choose between Low, Mid and High Volume. You might be wondering why choose Mid Volume when training for a 3
